definitions: The planned movement of troops, vehicles etc.; a strategic repositioning; (later also) a large training field-exercise of fighting units. Any strategic or cunning action; a stratagem. A movement of the body, or with an implement, instrument etc., especially one performed with skill or dexterity. A specific medical or surgical movement done with the doctor's hands or instruments. Controlled (especially skilful) movement taken while steering a vehicle.
examples: Joint NATO maneuvers are as much an exercise in diplomacy as in tactics and logistics.; The patriarch maneuvered till his offspring occupied countless key posts; Parallel parking can be a difficult maneuver
